result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrien L Kelley

records.addlTxt:
1:33 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Adrien L Kelley appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Joseph James Dorlack in court for Adrien L Kelley. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Defendant presents statements as to her appearing via Zoom.
Attorney Dorlack states he gave her the Zoom Meeting ID so that she can appear. 
Attorney Dorlack states he has received an offer that was contingent on waiving the prelim and would like to proceed with a prelim hearing.
Preliminary time limits waived. 
The Court will adjourn.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Adrien L Kelley in court.  Attorney Joseph James Dorlack in court for Adrien L Kelley.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Dorlack states he was just appointed yesterday and requests an adjournment of the preliminary hearing.
Attorney Dorlack further puts on record the defendant has mentioned she may be looking to retain Attorney Christopherson who represents her on her underlying case.
Preliminary time limits waived. 
Court will set a status on prelim given the defendant has shown interest in potentially retaining counsel and defense is uncertain yet if this will be a waiver or a hearing.  
If defendant does not waive the prelim, a preliminary hearing can then be set.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Jeremy Perri

ADDRESS INFO for Adrien L Kelley
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2022)
Prior: 6125 W Richmond Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant to have no contact with Davonte Underwood listed in the Criminal Complaint.

2:26 PM Defendant Adrien L Kelley in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Adrien L Kelley. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
